lines.content: When you run the application, the welcome screen shown below should appear and Bob is ready to accept your input from
Welcome to Bob, your personal task management chatbot!
It is a desktop app optimised for use via a Command Line Interface (CLI).
Bob helps you keep track of your todos, deadlines and events with ease.
You can add a task (todo, deadline or event), view the task list, search for tasks using keywords, mark a task as done,
unmark a task as not done and delete a task.
Add a todo to the task list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 task in the list.
Add a deadline with a specific due date to the task list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Add an event with a start and end time to the task list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
Display all tasks in the task list, together with the done status for each task.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Search for tasks using a keyword or multiple keywords.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Mark a task as done to show a "X" beside the task description.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
## Unmark a task as not done
Unmark a task as not done to remove the "X" beside the task description.
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
Delete a task from the task list.
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Now, if you input the command:
Here are the tasks in your list:
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
## Automatic Saving and Retrieval of Tasks
Bob automatically saves your tasks to a file after each operation (adding, deleting, marking/unmarking tasks).
This means you don't have to worry about losing your progress!
Every time you add, delete, mark or unmark a task, Bob automatically saves the updated task list to a file.
When you start Bob again, the program will automatically load your previously saved tasks from the file, allowing you
to continue from where you left off.
This feature ensures that all tasks persist even after you exit the application, providing a seamless user experience.
* Represents the main application class for the chatbot task management system.
* It manages the interaction between the user interface, task storage,
* Initialises the Bob application with the specified file path for storage.
* @param filePath The path to the file where tasks are stored.
* Runs the main loop of the application, allowing the user to input commands.
* The application continues until the user chooses to exit.
* The main method that starts the Bob application.
* Represents a command to add a deadline task.
* It parses the input to retrieve the description and deadline
* and adds the deadline task to the task list.
* Constructs an AddDeadlineCommand object with the specified user input.
* @param command The user's input string representing the deadline command.
* Executes the command to add a deadline task.
* It splits the input string into the task description and deadline,
* adds the deadline task to the task list, prints it via the UI,
* and stores it in the storage.
* @param tasks   The TaskList where the new task will be added.
* @param ui      The Ui object to handle the user interface output.
* @param storage The Storage object to save the task into the persistent storage.
* @throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException If the input format is incorrect (for example, missing deadline).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Indicates whether this command should exit the program.
* @return false, as this command does not exit the program.

public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {

* Indicates whether this command should exit the program.

* prints it via the UI, and stores it in the storage.

* Indicates whether this command should exit the program.
* @return false, as this command does not exit the program.
* Represents an abstract command that can be executed in the task management application.
* Subclasses of Command must implement the execute method to perform specific actions.
* Executes the command with the provided task list, user interface and storage.
* Each subclass of Command will define the specific behaviour when executed.
* @param tasks   The TaskList that the command will operate on.
* @param ui      The Ui object to interact with the user interface.
* @param storage The Storage object to handle saving of tasks.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage);
* Determines whether the command will exit the program.
* Each subclass will define whether the command is an exit command or not.
* @return true if the command exits the program, false otherwise.
* Represents a command to delete a task from the task list.
* This command removes a task based on its index and updates the task list accordingly.
* Constructs a DeleteCommand object with the specified index of the task to be deleted.
* @param taskIndex The index of the task to be deleted.
* Executes the delete task command, removing a task from the task list.
* If the task list is empty or an invalid index is provided, an error message is displayed.
* @param tasks   The TaskList that the command will operate on.
* @param ui      The Ui object to interact with the user interface.
* @param storage The Storage object to handle saving the updated task list.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Determines whether this command will exit the program.
* @return false as the delete command does not exit the program.
* Represents the command to exit the program.
* This command saves the current task list and displays an exit message.
* Executes the exit command, saving the task list and showing an exit message.
* @param tasks   The TaskList that the command will operate on.
* @param ui      The Ui object to interact with the user interface.
* @param storage The Storage object to handle saving the updated task list.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Determines whether this command will exit the program.
* @return true as the exit command will terminate the program.

* Executes the list command, displaying all tasks in the task list.

* @param storage The Storage object to handle saving and loading tasks (it is not used in this command).

* This command marks the specified task based on the provided index.
* Constructs a MarkCommand object with the specified task index.
* @param index The index of the task to be marked as done.
* Executes the mark command, marking the task at the given index as done.
* If the task is already marked, it shows an appropriate message.
* Handles cases where the task list is empty or the index is invalid.
* @param tasks   The TaskList that contains all tasks.
* @param ui      The Ui object to interact with the user interface.

* Executes the unmark command, unmarking the task at the given index.
* If the task is already unmarked, it shows an appropriate message.
* Handles cases where the task list is empty or the index is invalid.

* @param ui      The Ui object to interact with the user interface.
* @param storage The Storage object to handle saving the updated tasks.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {

* @throws IllegalArgumentException if the line format is invalid, a specific error message will be displayed.
